intro: Toddalia lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed Toddalia, is a tropical shrub native to regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, shady habitats such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
